segments.pli: “Ānāpānassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

segments.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati kathaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā?
segments.en: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.

segments.pli: So satova assasati, satova passasati … pe …
segments.en: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …
They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati evaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā.
segments.en: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.

segments.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitāya kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatiyā evaṃ bahulīkatāya satta phalā sattānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
segments.en: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect seven fruits and benefits.
You attain enlightenment early on in this very life.

segments.pli: no ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti.

segments.en: If not, you attain enlightenment at the time of death.

segments.pli: no ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti.
Atha pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti …
segments.en: If not, with the ending of the five lower fetters you’re extinguished in between one life and the next …
you head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm …

segments.pli: evaṃ bhāvitāya kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatiyā evaṃ bahulīkatāya ime satta phalā sattānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
segments.en: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect these seven fruits and benefits.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated…

suttaplex.blurb: Breath meditation is very beneficial. When developed it leads to perfection or one of the lesser attainments.
